means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 韦尔科姆住所名称，来源于古英语，含义是“泉，溪流+宽而直的河谷”(spring,stream+broad,straight valley)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 韦尔科姆绰号，受欢迎的人或好客的人，来源于中世纪英语及古法语或古诺斯语的仿造词
[地名] [澳大利亚、美国] 韦尔科姆

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"欢迎，致敬，致意，招呼"之意。
means: address ：侧重打招呼的方式或指所使用的称谓。
greet ：常指友好而热诚地欢迎。
salute ：正式用词，指用敬礼、亲吻或挥帽等动作向他人致意或问候，尤指以某种礼节欢迎某人。
hail ：主要指怀着敬意欢迎某人，侧重欢快轻松和嘈杂。也指隔得较远的高声招呼。
welcome ：多指热情的官方的或正式的迎接或欢迎，但也指一般的欢迎。

sentence.Network_en: You are welcome to visit the hospital at any time.
Lucy had strung a banner across the wall saying "Welcome Home Daddy".
sentence.Network_cn: 露西在墙上挂了一条横幅，上面写着“欢迎爸爸回家”。

sentence.Network_en: "Welcome back" was all they said. I could have kissed them!
sentence.Network_cn: 他们只是说，“欢迎回来。”我真想亲他们一下！

jx.jx_en_mean: stay as a visitor longer than one is wanted
jx.jx_cn_mean: （来访者）因呆得太久而不再受欢迎

jx.jx_en_mean: used as a polite response to thanks
jx.jx_cn_mean: ［用于礼貌地回答别人的感谢］别客气，不用谢

jx.jx_en_mean: To visit so often or stay so long as to become a nuisance.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 来访过密或呆得太久而变得令人讨厌

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wilcuma 'a person whose coming is pleasing', wilcumian (verb), from wil- 'desire, pleasure' + cuman 'come'. The first element was later changed to wel- 'well', influenced by Old French bien venu or Old Norse velkominn

entry.def: If you welcome someone, you greet them in a friendly way when they arrive somewhere.

example.ex: Several people came by to welcome me...
She was there to welcome him home from war...
example.tran: 她在那儿迎接他从战场归来。

entry.def: You use welcome in expressions such as welcome home ,welcome to London, and welcome back when you are greeting someone who has just arrived somewhere.

example.ex: Welcome back, Deborah—It's good to have you here.
example.tran: 欢迎回来，德博拉，有你在这儿真好。

entry.def: If you welcome an action, decision, or situation, you approve of it and are pleased that it has occurred.

example.ex: She welcomed this move but said that overall the changes didn't go far enough...
example.tran: 她欣然接受了这一举措，但是说总体上改变还不彻底。

example.ex: In Germany, the move was welcomed by the Bundesbank president.
example.tran: 在德国，联邦银行行长欣然接受了这项措施。

entry.def: If you describe something as welcome, you mean that people wanted it and are happy that it has occurred.

example.ex: This was certainly a welcome change of fortune...
example.tran: 这确实是命运中一个令人欣喜的转变。

example.ex: The new 25 metre pool for more serious swimmers is a welcome addition...
example.tran: 为更高水平的游泳爱好者新建的25米长的游泳池受到了大家的欢迎。

entry.def: If you say that you welcome certain people or actions, you are inviting and encouraging people to do something, for example to come to a particular place.

example.ex: We welcome you to join us on a special tour which explores this unique Australian attraction...
example.tran: 我们欢迎你加入探索这处独特的澳大利亚景观的特别之旅。

example.ex: We would welcome your views about the survey.
example.tran: 我们欢迎你就这项调查发表意见。

entry.def: If you say that someone is welcome in a particular place, you are encouraging them to go there by telling them that they will be liked and accepted.

example.ex: I told him he wasn't welcome in my home.
example.tran: 我告诉他我家不欢迎他。

entry.def: If you tell someone that they are welcome to do something, you are encouraging them to do it by telling them that they are allowed to do it.

example.ex: You are welcome to visit the hospital at any time.
...a conservatory which guests are welcome to use.
example.tran: 客人们可随意使用的温室

entry.tran: (表示十分乐意让别人拥有自己不想要的东西)尽管…好了
entry.def: If you say that someone is welcome to something, you mean that you do not want it yourself because you do not like it and you are very willing for them to have it.

example.ex: If women want to take on the business world they are welcome to it as far as I'm concerned.
example.tran: 就我而言，如果女人们想进军商界的话，就让她们去好了。

entry.tran: 使受欢迎;使感觉受欢迎
entry.def: If you make someone welcome or make them feel welcome, you make them feel happy and accepted in a new place.
If you say that someone outstays their welcome or overstays their welcome, you mean that they stay somewhere longer than they are wanted or expected to.

example.ex: After the kindness that had been shown to him, he didn't want to outstay his welcome.
example.tran: 在受到热情款待后，他决定离开以免过多打搅主人。

entry.def: You say 'You're welcome' to someone who has thanked you for something in order to acknowledge their thanks in a polite way.

example.tran: “谢谢你提供的信息。”——“ 不客气。”

means.word_mean: 2. bid welcome to; greet upon arrival
3. receive someone, as into one's house
1. giving pleasure or satisfaction or received with pleasure or freely granted;

auth_sentence.content: Sweet and subtle, it never outstays its welcome.
auth_sentence.res_content: Sweet and subtle, it never outstays its welcome.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Sweet and subtle, it never outstays its welcome.

auth_sentence.content: But once again, the welcome is often qualified.
auth_sentence.res_content: But once again, the welcome is often qualified.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But once again, the welcome is often qualified.

Sentence.sentence: Good evening, and welcome to this week's Business World, the program for and about business people.
In the process he brought about great changes in computing, music, telecoms and the news business that were painful for existing firms but welcomed by millions of consumers.
Good evening and welcome to this week's Business World.
Good evening and welcome to tonight's edition of Legendary Lives.

sentences.en: He welcomed you to enjoy his hospitality.

means.word_mean: 被允许的; 可随意取用的

sentences.en: You are welcome to the use of my books.
Welcome!Come in and meet my parents.
sentences.cn: 欢迎!进来见见我的父母。

jushi.english: She will welcome the chance to see you again .
jushi.chinese: 她将愉快地期待着有机会再次见到你。

jushi.english: We welcome the opportunity to express our gratitude.
jushi.chinese: 我们能有机会表示感谢十分高兴。
